title: 13 Best Eco-Friendly & Organic Mattress Toppers - Good Good Good
summary: The article discusses the benefits of organic and non-toxic mattress toppers that enhance sleep hygiene while promoting environmental sustainability. It highlights various brands that prioritize eco-friendly materials, ethical manufacturing processes, and social responsibility in their products. Additionally, it provides honest reviews of specific mattress toppers based on their environmental impact and health considerations. The article emphasizes making informed choices when selecting bedding products to support a sustainable lifestyle.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article focuses on mattress toppers made from organic and non-toxic materials that minimize environmental impact, align with sustainability goals, and promote health benefits.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article reviews and recommends new or improved products (mattress toppers) that differ significantly from conventional options and have been introduced in the market.
green_product: TRUE, since the discussed mattress toppers are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle, using sustainable and non-toxic materials.
green_process: TRUE, as the companies mentioned utilize production processes that focus on minimizing waste, conserving natural resources, and ensuring ethical labor practices.
company: Savvy Rest, Holy Lamb Organics, Saatva, Avocado Green Mattress, Brentwood Home, Parachute, Birch, Coyuchi, Happsy, Boll & Branch, PlushBeds, Turmerry, My Green Mattress
official_company_name: Savvy Rest, Holy Lamb Organics, Saatva, Avocado Green Mattress, Brentwood Home, Parachute, Birch, Coyuchi, Happsy, Boll & Branch, PlushBeds, Turmerry, My Green Mattress
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 314110 - Carpet and Rug Mills, 337910 - Mattress Manufacturing, 339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing, 424990 - Other Miscellaneous Nondurable Goods Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article provides transparent and credible information about the companies' sustainable practices and product benefits without misleading claims.

title: Shop Kate Bosworth's Blue Crush-Inspired Roxy Swimwear - POPSUGAR
summary: Kate Bosworth has launched a sustainable swimwear collection in collaboration with Roxy, inspired by her 2002 film 'Blue Crush.' The collection, which includes a variety of surf-inspired styles, emphasizes eco-conscious materials like recycled nylon and organic cotton. It promotes a positive message of kindness and environmental consciousness, aiming to appeal to free-spirited surf enthusiasts.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the collection emphasizes eco-conscious materials and practices, reducing environmental impact through the use of recycled nylon and organic cotton.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the collaboration represents a new product line that significantly differs from previous offerings by Roxy, utilizing innovative sustainable materials and designs.
green_product: TRUE, because the swimwear collection is designed and manufactured using environmentally-friendly fabrics that significantly reduce its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because the production practices emphasize sustainability by using eco-conscious materials and minimizing environmental impact.
official_company_name: Roxy, a division of Quiksilver, Inc.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 448190 - Other Clothing Stores, 315240 - Women's Clothing Manufacturing, 541430 - Graphic Design Services, 316999 - All Other Leather Good Manufacturing.
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article does not provide misleading or exaggerated claims about the environmental benefits of the products; instead, it clearly communicates the sustainable intentions behind the collection.
